009package ImageJ_Demos;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.ImageStack;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015
016/**
017 * <p>
018 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates how to iterate over the frames (slices) of an
019 * image stack. In this case each frame is simply inverted. No new frames are
020 * added to the stack. Note that stack slices are numbered from 1,...,K (i.e.,
021 * there is no slice 0)!
022 * </p>
023 * <p>
024 * If {@link PlugInFilter#STACK_REQUIRED} is omitted in
025 * {@link #setup(String, ImagePlus)}, the plugin will also work on ordinary
026 * (single) images.
027 * </p>
028 * 
029 * @author WB
030 *
031 */
032public class Stack_Processing_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
033        
034        ImagePlus im = null;    // keep a reference to the associated ImagePlus object
035        
036        public int setup(String args, ImagePlus im) {
037                this.im = im;
038                return DOES_ALL + STACK_REQUIRED;
039        }
040
041        public void run(ImageProcessor ignored) {
042                ImageStack stack = im.getImageStack();
043                int K = stack.getSize();
044                for (int k = 1; k <= K; k++) {  // NOTE: slices are numbered from 1,...,K !!
045                        ImageProcessor ip = stack.getProcessor(k);
046                        ip.invert();
047                }
048        }
049}
